findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: DeFi protocols typically have a number of system-wide parameters that can be dynamically configured on demand. The ZKT protocol is no exception. Specifically, if we examine the `ZKTDeposit` contract, it has defined a system-wide risk parameter: `lockTime`. In the following, we show the corresponding routine that allows for its changes.

findings.title: Incompatibility with Deflationary/Rebasing Tokens
findings.description: The ZKTWhiteList contract is incompatible with deflationary/rebasing tokens due to its asset-transferring routines working only as expected with standard ERC20 tokens, and may require additional checks for accurate book-keeping.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the ZKT contracts, there are two special administrative accounts, i.e., _owner and admin. These two privileged accounts play critical roles in governing and regulating the entire operation and maintenance.
